alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 9:27PM MST until August 04 at 12:30AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1230 AM MST. * At 927 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This dangerous storms has produced 0.9 inches of rain in 7 minutes. This storm will track from Tombstone toward Benson. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Benson, St. David, Kartchner Caverns State Park and Fairbank. This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Sibyl Rd at Gila/Dragoon Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
